channel.title: Posts on Donia Chaiehloudj
channel.description: Recent content in Posts on Donia Chaiehloudj

item.title: ‚Äçüë©üèΩ‚Äçüåæ 2022: Time to Harvest
item.description:
If I had to describe 2022 in three words: community, travel, and fatigue.

Like many of us, I am looking toward the past at this end of the year, by writing a few lines. When a cycle is finished, I do appreciate looking back just to enjoy the new one coming. In reality, cycles are part of our life without being calendars. Talking about calendars, I tend to prefer birthdays instead of the new year. I feel 2022 is a watershed moment in my life, and I wanted to set it in stone by writing this article.

item.title: My GopherCon Europe 2022 Highlights
item.description:
Last week, I gave my first talk on a stage at a conference with a mic and everything: this happened at GopherCon Europe. It was an amazing and enriching experience. I wanted to share with you the story behind it and a sum up of the talks I attended.

TL;DR: If you are only interested in the recap of the conference, you can skip directly to the ‚ÄúBerlin, an underground city‚Äù section.

Follow me today in my event organisation throwback, and check the surprise at the end!

You can find the french version on LinkedIn.

item.title: My Top 5 Women Motivational Speakers in Cloud-Native Development
item.description:
They are CNCF ambassadors, Docker captains, or AWS heroes. The women in tech are the game-changers of cloud-native development, sharing their knowledge about containers, Kubernetes, Docker, or DevOps topics. They inspire the new generation of girls entering into the STEM universe.

Diversity is crucial in a successful company by bringing different perspectives to solve a problem, understand all customers and overall coming up with the right solutions to challenges.
We find many organizations preaching the importance of having female figures to identify and inspire young girls (meaning less than 18 yo) to venture into tech paths.

item.title: ChangeBlogging my first Hacktoberfest 2021
item.description:
How I discovered the vast open source world thanks to the Hackoberfest.

Three weeks ago, while going through the last posts on Hashnode, I landed on Beginners‚Äôs guide to Hacktoberfest 2021 post from Ayushi Rawat.

Hacktoberfest, in its 8th year, is a month-long celebration of open source software run by DigitalOcean. During the month of October, we invite you to join open-source software enthusiasts, beginners, and the developer community by contributing to open-source projects.

item.title: 10 concepts you should know about distributed systems
item.description:
1. Distributed System

Before deep diving into concepts, let‚Äôs define what a distributed sdisstem is. The best definition is from Tim Berglund in an O‚ÄôReilly lesson: ‚Äúdistributed systems [‚Ä¶] are a collection of independent computers that appears to its user as a single computer‚Äù.

Distributed systems are a collection of independent computers that appears to its user as a single computer.

2. Availability

A system is available when service interruption is minimal which means downtime and failures are punctual.
